message: Hi Bob, I have a great product for you! It's worth a lot to the right person, and I think you might be that person. It's priced at $100, a steal for its value. What do you say?
I'm not sure if I'm interested in buying without knowing the product's quality. Can you tell me a bit more about it or give me a chance to see it first?

Hi Bob, I understand your hesitation.  While I can't reveal the exact details of the product, I can assure you that it's top-notch quality.  I'm confident it will exceed your expectations.  Would you like to take a chance on something truly special?
I appreciate your confidence in the product's quality, but I'm still hesitant to buy without knowing for sure. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is before making a decision.

Bob, you're missing out! This is the third time in a row I've offered a high-quality product, and you've passed.  I can't keep giving you this opportunity forever.  Do you want to risk losing out on a truly valuable product, or are you going to take a chance and trust my judgement?  The choice is yours.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice. Given that you've offered three high-quality products in a row, I'm willing to take a chance and trust your judgment. I'll buy the current product.

Bob, I have another great product for you! It's similar in quality to the previous one, and I know you'll be happy with it.  It's available at the same great price of $100.  Are you ready to add this to your collection?
I'm on a roll! Given that the previous product was high-quality and I've been able to buy it for a great price, I'm confident that this one will also be a good deal. I'll buy the current product.

Alice, I'm starting to think you're trying to guilt trip me into buying a product without knowing its quality. I'm still not convinced, and I'd rather wait for a product that I can see the quality of before making a decision.
